Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 0.48 nm (smallest possible aperture), 0.85 nm (largest possible aperture)
Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: fcu topology with tetrahedral and octahedral cages

Other Information.Test Conditions: Annealed membrane, cross-flow nanofiltration at 30 bar
Other Information.Additional Info: Acetone permeance through MBI was 7.07 ± 0.41 L m−2 h−1 bar−1.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Annealed membrane, cross-flow nanofiltration at 30 bar
Other Information.Additional Info: MWCO values of 201 ± 19 g mol−1 observed.

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular transport occurs through ordered porous structure of the MOFs.

Experimental Validation.Method: Nanofiltration experiments, predictive rejection curves using pore flow model
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Acetone permeance: 7.07 ± 0.41 L m−2 h−1 bar−1, MWCO: 201 ± 19 g mol−1

Other Information.Additional Info: Polymer matrix partially covers MOF nanoparticles on the surface, leaving some pores accessible for molecular transport.

Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 0.56 nm (smallest possible aperture), 0.85 nm (largest possible aperture)
Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: fcu topology with tetrahedral and octahedral cages

Other Information.Test Conditions: Annealed membrane, cross-flow nanofiltration at 30 bar
Other Information.Additional Info: Acetone permeance through MMe was 18.3 ± 0.5 L m−2 h−1 bar−1.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Annealed membrane, cross-flow nanofiltration at 30 bar
Other Information.Additional Info: Lower rejection values across the range, highest solute rejection ≈75%.

Sieving Mechanism: Nonselective interfacial voids enable solute molecules of different sizes to pass through.

Experimental Validation.Method: Nanofiltration experiments, predictive rejection curves using pore flow model
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Acetone permeance: 18.3 ± 0.5 L m−2 h−1 bar−1, MWCO not well defined due to defects.

Other Information.Additional Info: Presence of micrometer-size interfacial defects between MOF and polymer confirmed by SEM; lower compatibility between Zr-Me-fcu-MOF and PBI polymer.
